description: The best-selling collection from British cartoonist Andy Riley. This comic strip collection takes a darkly humorous look at what happens when a cute little bunny and his friends no longer want to live, and take their own lives in a series of increasingly inventive and amusing ways.

First part of the Malédiction Des Trente Deniers storyline which was started by illustrator René Sterne, who completed 23 inked pages and 5 or 6 additional pencilled ones before his untimely death. His widow Chantal De Spiegeleer chose to complete his work.
name: La Malédiction des Trente Deniers  Tome 1: Le Manuscrit de Nicodemus

volume.name: Les Aventures De Blake Et Mortimer

description: Initially published periodically in the Belgian daily Le Soir from April 10 2012 onwards before being collected as an album by Les Editions Blake Et Mortimer later the same year.
name: Le Serment des Cinq Lords

volume.name: Les Aventures De Blake Et Mortimer

description: Second part of the Malédiction Des Trente Deniers storyline which was initially published periodically in Planète BD from October 2010 onwards before being collected as an album by Les Editions Blake Et Mortimer later the same year.
name: La Malédiction des Trente Deniers  Tome 2: La Porte d'Orphée

volume.name: Les Aventures De Blake Et Mortimer

description: The final show off Mr. Friend kidnaps July and only Spring Heeled Jack can help her, Miss Gereveux reluctant at first let's Jack go to save her, but afraid that this final mission for the Tulpa would let it loose upon the world with no need of July anymore. Spring Heeled Jack saves July and completes his mission and kills Mr. Friend. With nothing else for him, he fades away into the night not to be seen again. Or so they think.
name: A Mystery of Mysteries

description: A detective investigating the various murders conducts his search and ties July to the mysterious perpetrator known as Spring Heeled Jack, he tracks down her residence to find the elderly Miss Gereveux. Desperate for answers he interrogates the woman and finds out Spring Heeled Jack is truly a Tulpa July summoned to exact revenge on Mr. Friend.
name: A Mystery of Mysteries

description: Tension rises as Spring Heeled Jack's attacks on Mr. Friend's gang grow more frequent and brutal. Miss Gereveux grows concerned for her Grand Daughter July, and confronts July's Devil. What does she know?
name: A Mystery of Mysteries

description: Two short stories by Ray Bradbury, adapted in comic book style. "The City" -- about a city what is alive, and fighting off invaders -- was adaped by Mike Mignola, lettered by Willie Schubert. "Usher II" -- a modern interpretation of Poe's usher, aimed at the meddlers who claimed fantasy was bad for children --was adapted by James Van Hise, illustrated by Ron Wilber, and lettered by Kurt Hathaway. Introduction by Ray Bradbury.
name: Alien Terror

description:
Figure out your destiny. Defeat a demigod. And do it all before sunrise. That's the challenge facing Gary Doyle tonight.

Afflicted by a curse that turns him into a stone gargoyle every night, Gary Doyle has been passing the time punching out creepy crawly underworld demons and trying to figure out how to undo the curse. When a raging demigod bent on annihilation begins rampaging through the city, Doyle, coached by the mysterious gypsy, Drina, and assisted by the equally enchanting archaeologist, Chloe Anders, must decide whether he's a hero or the monster the world sees him as.

GARGOYLE BY MOONLIGHT is a 36-page monster-punching thrill ride! A standalone, complete story, this supernatural urban fantasy comic is fun old school storytelling with charming characters and stunning visuals.

name: Vampress Luxura Red Reign Rising Volume 1

person_credits.name: Kirk Lindo
person_credits.role: writer, editor, artist, penciler, inker, cover

description:
"Captain Action and the Riddle of the Glowing Men" is a Standard Sized Trade Paperback that is Black & White with a 194 page count.

Written and Illustrated by Story Jim Beard Interior llustrations Rob Davis Cover illustration Nick Runge
name: Captain Action Riddle of the Glowing Men

volume.name: Captain Action Riddle of the Glowing Men

description: Katie Spencer was an average teenage girl. High school, homework, friends, loving parents, and a devoted boyfriend. She WAS an average teenage girl, until the day she discovered she had superpowers. The problem is, no one else on Earth has them. Super powers are strictly the stuff of fiction to her. There’s no previous generation of heroes to show her the way. So, where’s a girl to go to learn how to be a superhero? Yeah, she goes for those works of fiction. See what happens when an average teenage girl (with explosive powers) reads a bunch of comic books and tries to become the world’s first superhero! See as she struggles in vain to find a bad guy to fight! See Katie Spencer become… Bombshell!
name: Bombshell

description: Katie Spencer was an average teenage girl. High school, homework, friends, loving parents, and a devoted boyfriend. Then she discovered she had superpowers in a world where such things do not exist. She tried her best to become a real superhero, despite the challenges involved. Rather than stopping crime, she was being brought home by the police every other night for breaking curfew. She couldn’t even figure out how the superheroes in movies and comics so routinely found bad guys to fight. Then, one night, she finally did it. She stopped a real criminal. She felt on top of the world, until she ran back to her boyfriend’s house to celebrate… Following last issue’s shocking ending, see how Katie’s life is upended by the world she’s stumbled into. Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned. If only she could ever figure out how to find the bad guys.
name: Bombshell

description: It’s finally here! Following last issue’s “not-as-shocking-as-the-first-issue-but-still-hopefully-kind-of-fun” ending, the post-penultimate issue of Bombshell is ready to knock your proverbial socks off (editor’s note: if you’re not currently wearing socks, please go put some on. Our metaphor kind of falls apart if you’re sockless). Katie Spencer found herself suddenly in possession of a mysterious set of energy-based powers, making her the world’s first real superhero. She wasn’t good at it. But now, she’ll have to become better than she’s been if she expects to survive. Or, is she just a crazy person who’s been rambling nonsense to her psychiatrist? All your questions will be answered! Questions you didn’t even know you had before will also be answered! All will be revealed in the final issue of this inaugural Bombshell mini-series!
name: Bombshell

description: Part one! Monster hunter Irro is perhaps the only person in Kevala making a good living. The city pays him and his tailed assistant, Hari, a bounty for each monster carcass they bring in. But one day a religious sect called The Way of Sacred Peace comes to Kevala to solve the monster problem by capping the city's Spirit Fountain. Out of a job with all the monsters gone, Irro and Hari are determined to prove there is a more sinister plot behind Sacred Peace's plan.
name: Part One

description: Adventures on and under the high seas lead a cursed pirate girl to encounter mythic creatures, gnarled and crusty pirates, and ghostly apparitions as she tries to find her lost father, one of the dreaded Pirate Captains of the mythical Omerta Seas. A whimsical swashbuckling tale of wonderland journeys and unimaginable dangers, starting in Port Elisabeth, Jamaica in the year 1728, and quickly heading across-and beneath-the waves.
name: Part One

description: Part two! Adventures on and under the high seas lead a cursed pirate girl to encounter mythic creatures, gnarled and crusty pirates, and ghostly apparitions as she tries to find her lost father, one of the dreaded Pirate Captains of the mythical Omerta Seas. A whimsical swashbuckling tale of wonderland journeys and unimaginable dangers, starting in Port Elisabeth, Jamaica in the year 1728, and quickly heading across-and beneath-the waves.
name: Part Two

name: Part Three

description: Adventures on and under the high seas lead a cursed pirate girl to encounter mythic creatures, gnarled and crusty pirates, and ghostly apparitions as she tries to find her lost father, one of the dreaded Pirate Captains of the mythical Omerta Seas. A whimsical swashbuckling tale of wonderland journeys and unimaginable dangers, starting in Port Elisabeth, Jamaica in the year 1728, and quickly heading across-and beneath-the waves. The first three issues are collected with an all-new epilogue.
name: TPB

description: On the Eastern Front during World War II, Oberleutnant Wulf, a young Luftwaffe pilot, is horrified by Nazi barbarism and at odds with his fellow pilots, even as he finds himself taking to the skies to fight the infamous 'Night Witches,' the 588th Night Bomber Regiment, the most decorated female unit in the Soviet Air Force. Motivated only by his desire to return home to his daughter, Romy, Wulf tries to survive the increasingly desperate and ferocious Eastern Front, while Lilya, the 'Red Witch,' leads her comrades against the German invaders.
name: Part Two

description: Part 3! On the Eastern Front during World War II, Oberleutnant Wulf, a young Luftwaffe pilot, is horrified by Nazi barbarism and at odds with his fellow pilots, even as he finds himself taking to the skies to fight the infamous 'Night Witches,' the 588th Night Bomber Regiment, the most decorated female unit in the Soviet Air Force. description: Trapped on an island off the coast of Maine, the people of Hopeless find life a little darker and more dangerous with every day that passes. The number of orphans rises continually, but who can say what happens to their parents? Plenty of the bodies are never found. This is not the stuff of happy, careless childhoods, it is instead fertile ground for personal demons. In Hopeless, the demons are not always abstract concepts. Some of them have very real teeth, and very real horns.
name: Part Two

description: 140 pages! Trapped on an island off the coast of Maine, the people of Hopeless find life a little darker and more dangerous with every day that passes. The number of orphans rises continually, but who can say what happens to their parents? Plenty of the bodies are never found. Part one! It is the aftermath of a long war, in a world of constant winter. An intelligence spy from the Resistance - the rabbit, Hardin - steals secret information from a military base of the Regime. His actions set off a chain of events that reverberates through the ranks of both sides, touching everyone from Pavel the crow to Giles the goat, from the highest-ranking officials to the smallest orphaned child. When the snow finally settles, who will be the true patriot and who the true traitor? A spellbinding, beautifully illustrated anthropomorphic tale.
name: Part One

description: Part 2! It is the aftermath of a long war, in a world of constant winter. name: Part Three

description: Part one! In the distant future, Elijah is a member of the 'Philosophical Police,' who must solve conflicts that arise out of ignorance of the Other. Two species are fighting a war with roots in a crime committed centuries ago, and Elijah must solve the crime and bring peace between their species, while also confronting his own immortality in a world where science provides access to eternal life. In a world where death no longer exists, why do so many want to give up on life? Translated from the award-winning French graphic novel.
name: Part One

description: Part two! In the distant future, Elijah is a member of the 'Philosophical Police,' who must solve conflicts that arise out of ignorance of the Other. name: Part Four

description: Once Kadam was a rising star in the ranks of the Mumbai Encounter Squad, a secret unit tasked with carrying out extrajudicial executions of wanted criminals that turned it into a business for contract killings and extortion. However the death of his pregnant wife at childbirth triggers a downward spiral that leaves Kadam a pale shadow of his former self. When Kadam is the victim of a hit-and-run that also claims the life of a street urchin, he goes into a coma for a month. After waking up, he finds a new sense of purpose and pursues the investigation into the identity of the driver on his own, when the police close the case for lack of leads. Kadam finds out that the driver was Balwan Khan, an over-the-hill Bollywood B-Movie actor. This brings him into direct confrontation with his ex-colleagues, who are now de factor gangsters in uniform and use Khan's movies to launder their money... A hardboiled crime-noir tale set in Mumbai and told though the eyes of Arjun Kadam, a washed-out drug-addicted ex-cop.
name: Good Cop, Bad Cop Part One

description: Once Kadam was a rising star in the ranks of the Mumbai Encounter Squad, a secret unit tasked with carrying out extrajudicial executions of wanted criminals that turned it into a business for contract killings and extortion. However the death of his pregnant wife at childbirth triggers a downward spiral that leaves Kadam a pale shadow of his former self. When Kadam is the victim of a hit-and-run that also claims the life of a street urchin, he goes into a coma for a month. After waking up, he finds a new sense of purpose and pursues the investigation into the identity of the driver on his own, when the police close the case for lack of leads. Kadam finds out that the driver was Balwan Khan, an over-the-hill Bollywood B-Movie actor. This brings him into direct confrontation with his ex-colleagues, who are now de factor gangsters in uniform and use Khan's movies to launder their money. A hardboiled crime-noir tale set in Mumbai and told though the eyes of Arjun Kadam, a washed-out drug-addicted ex-cop.
name: Good Cop, Bad Cop Part Two

description: Based on the classic science fiction television series SPACE: 1999-- and set in the continuity of the original series, AFTERSHOCK AND AWE steals a glimpse at an alternate history of mankind, and jump-starts humanity's eventual destiny far out in space.
name: Aftershock & Awe, Part 2

description: A carefully selected body of original SPACE: 1999 comics from the 1970s, SPACE:1999- CLASSIC is a celebration of the series that not only looks back in retro nostalgia --but also forward to the future of this dynamic space epic. After suffering the loss of Victor Bergman, Paul Morrow, and David Kano, John Koenig and Moonbase Alpha find themselves at the mercy of an alien mastermind and a biological computer that eats minds. Their only hope is to appeal to the mercy of the madman's daughter, a shape shifting young woman called Maya, and convince her of her father's sinister plan! Part one of a two part adaptation of the season two episode of SPACE: 1999 "The Metamorph" -- expanded to include both new and cut dialogue, and utilizing the remastered art of comics legend Gray Morrow! Within these pages are not simply reprints, but remastered works, most in color for the first time. With respect to the intent and spirit of the original body of work, these comics have been enhanced and clarified within both the story and art, in order to bring these Alphan adventures more in line with both the established continuity of the original Space: 1999 original televised series and the new graphic novel series.
name: Part One
